Package graphanalyzer.view.dialogs

Class MessageDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphanalyzer.view.dialogs.MessageDialog
  • public final class MessageDialog
extends java.lang.Object
    Message dialog to inform the user at any time.

    Usage: 

     MessageDialog.showMessage("The algorithm computed successfully.","Success"); // Open a new message dialog
 
 MessageDialog.showWarning("Please provide a GraphML file.","Wrong data type"); // Open a new message dialog
 
 MessageDialog.showMessage("Something went wrong, please restart the application.","Error"); // Open a new message dialog
    Author:
    paulehler

    • Method Detail

      • showMessage

        public static void showMessage​(java.lang.String message,
                               java.lang.String title)
        Shows an information message dialog.
        Parameters:
        message - the text to be shwon as message dialog
        title - the title of the message dialog; if null the default title "Graph Analyzer" is used

      • showWarning

        public static void showWarning​(java.lang.String message,
                               java.lang.String title)
        Shows a warning message dialog.
        Parameters:
        message - the text to be shwon as message dialog
        title - the title of the message dialog; if null the default title "Graph Analyzer" is used

      • showError

        public static void showError​(java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.String title)
        Shows an error message dialog to inform the user that something went wrong.
        Parameters:
        message - the text to be shwon as message dialog
        title - the title of the message dialog; if null the default title "Graph Analyzer" is used

      • show

        private static void show​(java.lang.String messageText,
                         java.lang.String messageTitle,
                         int type)
        Display message dialog of given type.
        Parameters:
        messageText - message text to display
        messageTitle - title of dialog
        type - type of message
